item.title: Rebellion via MDM Prison Break with Odin (Part I)
item.description:
This is the first part of my blog where I attempt to flash a new OS into a tablet, that has been carrying a firmware, locked down with heavy restrictions.

For context, I’ve got my hands on a government-provided Samsung tablet (won’t be disclosing model or the provider for paranoia-reasons) which has been “locked” for general usage, and allows only 8 applications that can be used (restricted using a third party MDM software), strictly for academic purposes (including instagram for whatever reasons?).

item.title: About Me
item.description:
I’m curious about astrophysics, tech and am highly interested in social justice. This portfolio mostly consists of my techie side, with a hint of other stuff as well in an (as you’ve already figured out) extremely informal tone.

I’ve tilted my career towards RTL Design cuz of my ever lasting love for mathematics and physics. I’ve tasted a lil bit of everything I could (Linux, android application Reverse engineering, RTL Design, Computer Architecture, pure mathematics), and my list of ‘Stuff I love’ only grew as I explored more.

item.title: Contact Me
item.description: You can contact me via Email or LinkedIn. I usually respond within a few hours. I can’t guarantee about insta DMs tho :)

item.title: Experience
item.description:
Working as an FPGA Dev, exploring various ways and applications of reconfigurable edge ML acceleration.
I’m also very passionate about Linux and computer architecture in general.
